pages.md:
# AF/MF SETTING (Movie Recording)

## SUBJECT DETECTION SETTING

Options are the same as those for still photography, but settings must be adjusted separately.

> ðŸ’¡ **Note:**  
> The camera automatically switches to continuous AF when **SUBJECT DETECTION ON** is selected for **AF/MF SETTING > SUBJECT DETECTION SETTING**, even if **SINGLE AF** is selected for **FOCUS MODE**. Subject detection is not available during manual focus, even when **SUBJECT DETECTION ON** is selected for **SUBJECT DETECTION SETTING**.

## AF+MF

Select **ON** to enable manual focus in **SINGLE AF** and **CONTINUOUS AF** modes. Manual focus can be suspended by pressing the **AF-ON** button.

| Options |
|---------|
| ON      |
| OFF     |

## MF ASSIST

Choose how focus is displayed when **MANUAL FOCUS** is selected for **FOCUS MODE**.

| Option                       | Description                                                                 |
|------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| FOCUS PEAK HIGHLIGHT         | The camera heightens high-contrast outlines. Choose a color and peaking level. |
| FOCUS METER                  | A needle indicates whether focus is in front of or behind the subject.      |
| FOCUS METER + PEAK HIGHLIGHT | Focus is indicated by both a meter and peak highlights.                     |
| OFF                          | Focus is displayed normally (MF assist cannot be used).                     |
